front.title: Virtual Private LAN Service (VPLS) Using BGP for Auto-discovery and Signaling

abstract.t: Virtual Private LAN Service (VPLS), also known as Transparent LAN Service, and Virtual Private Switched Network service, is a useful Service Provider offering. The service offers a Layer 2 Virtual Private Network (VPN); however, in the case of VPLS, the customers in the VPN are connected by a multipoint Ethernet Local Area Network (LAN), in contrast to the usual Layer 2 VPNs, which are point-to- point in nature. This document describes the functions required to offer VPLS, a mechanism for signaling a VPLS, and rules for forwarding VPLS frames across a packet switched network.
